title: no way to upgrade from oc5012 to oc6 (bitnami stack)
body:
hallo,

actually i try to upgrade my owncloud installation to version 6.0.0. but i have many heavy problems to do this. 

what i have done:
1) backup everything
2) deactivate all third party apps in oc
3) stop server
4) delete htdocs where oc is installed
5) unpack the new oc version in this directory
"6) modify config.php" (i also try it without modify it)
6) open the start page 

first, i didn't find the configuration because its was a drop down and i wonder why my modified config.php was resetted every time to sqlite3. what ever.

after i recordnized the setup drop down, i entered the data to my data folder and my mysql database.

after that i had different problems:

1) when i use my old admin user, then oc6 give a message that the user is already used. anyway.
2) then i used another user as admin. then the first time oc6 tell me it cannot create the table 'oc_jobs' because it already exist.
3) then i try another way:
- delete everything
- reset database again
- modify config.php because there is no other way to enter the database prefix
- enter all the other data for database connection and for data folder and app folder
- start the setup page and entered also the data here again.
but it also fails with an error that the table "oc_activity" already exist.

i'm sorry, but i have no idea what the problem is and what i can do to upgrade to oc6. 

my system:
- macos
- oc: bitnami stack with oc 5.0.12 (data and config folder are one level above the owncloud installation)
- mysql with table prefix oc_ and user bitnami_owncloud

it would be great if you could help me. i think there is a heavy bug when upgrading a database which uses a table prefix
